abstract: Contractors with billions of dollars at stake could be big losers, but European Union officials said a meeting next week on the project would still take place.
snippet: Contractors with billions of dollars at stake could be big losers, but European Union officials said a meeting next week on the project would still take place.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Energy executives across Europe were scrambling on Tuesday to understand the implications of President Vladimir V. Putin’s surprise announcement that Russia would scrap the long-planned South Stream project that was to pipe natural gas to Europe.

headline.main: Putin’s Surprise Call to Scrap South Stream Gas Pipeline Leaves Europe Reeling
headline.print_headline: Putin’s Surprise Call to Scrap South Stream Gas Pipeline Leaves Europe Reeling

byline.original: By Stanley Reed and James Kanter
